result.execSummary:
The defendant Roy John Berger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roy John Berger

records.addlTxt:
02:59 PM Defendant, Roy John Berger, appeared with Attorney Adam C Benson.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Court notes PLQ filed, recites agreement from PLQ: def pleading G to possession of THC with joint rec for DNA surcharge only.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Defs constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea. 
 Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 and orders a JOC; count 2 is DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def declines to make a statement to the Court.  Court assesses the $200 DNA surcharge, waives all other court costs.  Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.  Def to pay in full today.

ADDRESS INFO for Roy John Berger
Current: 216 16th Ave E, Superior, WI 54880 United States  (Effective: 05-09-2022)
Prior: 4256 Thornhill Ln, Vadais Heights, MN 55127
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:03 AM Defendant, Roy John Berger, appeared with Attorney Adam C Benson.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Roy John Berger appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case on for final pre-trial.  Defense attorney updates the Court: resolution reached- def to plead G to THC, DRI ct 2; rec for DNA sample and surcharge only.  Court requires $200 to be prepaid and to appear in person.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
